cow_milk.description: He's moved from formula to cow milk.  Three or four bottles a day (down from seven) and dropping, as he eats more solid food.
cow_milk.title: Cow Milk

fork.description: Felix now eats his morning yogurt & cheerios with a spoon by himself.  We started forks this week;  as long as you load the fork for him, it mostly gets in his mouth.  Here, he's having a late supper and trying to mix sleep with meal.
fork.title: Fork

martine.description: After eschewing soft toys his entire first year, he's now sometimes into carrying around something a little cuddly.   This is Martine.
martine.title: Martine

small_place1.description: Fascination with small places continues.  He's becoming more creative about finding (or creating) such spaces.
small_place1.title: Small Place 1

small_place2.description: He charges five cookies an hour to fix leaks.
small_place2.title: Small Place 2

toothbrush.description: After months of lusting after dad's toothbrush, Felix finally gets his own, with special baby toothpaste.
toothbrush.title: Toothbrush

window1.description: The window is a great place to watch the world and learn all about parallel parking.
window1.title: Window 1

description:
Everybody's in a fine fettle here. Felix is over jet lag, sleeping to the positively luxurious hour of 6am. He says bye bye, but not with regularity. He seems to repeat words that we say: tree, pear, isomorphic (not sure about that last one). We're absoutely sure he knows "come here", even though he gives no indication of it. I hear that this is such a hard concept that many kids never learn it.

Dean and Lucie even got to go out on a date. But that doesn't go on the website.
title: January 26
